page.title: 15OVER WYRESDALE:EDUCATION
page.content: There is no longer any school here and all children have to travel out of the area to receive their formal education. For the youngest children a playgroup is run once a week in the old Sunday School room. In 1985 seven children attend this group. Some older pre-school children also attend the Group held twice a week at Dolphin- holme School and some of the children of primary school age go on to this school. The remainder of the children under 12 attend Abbeystead School. Practically all children of secondary age go to school in Lancaster where the choice of school is still limited by the 11+ examination. Leaving home for further education is quite rare but some of the teenagers not staying on to the sixthform attend courses at Morecambe College of Further Education or Winmarleigh College of Agriculture.
